contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {{Knot-details | name=Catshank | image= | names= | type= shortening | strength= | origin= | related= [[Sheepshank]], [[Dogshank]] | releasing= | uses= | caveat= | abok_number= }} The '''catshank''' is a variant of the [[sheepshank]], clinched by two [[overhand knot]]s with the [[bight (knot)|bights]] passed through the twists (one end of the rope must be available to tie the overhands). ==See also== *[[List of knots]] ==Further reading== *[[Raoul Graumont|Graumont, Raoul]] (1945) ''Handbook of Knots''. {{Knots}} {{Knot-stub}}
